contentrichtext.text: '''Viscount Hall''', of [[Cynon Valley]] in the [[County]] of [[Glamorgan]], was a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created on 28 October 1946 for the [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] [[politician]] [[George Hall, 1st Viscount Hall|George Hall]]. The title became extinct upon the death of his son, the second Viscount, in 1985. He married had pioneering Leicestershire businesswoman Alice Walker in 1962. <ref>{{cite news|title=ON THIS DAY 25 YEARS AGO|url=http://www.thisisleicestershire.co.uk/DAY-25-YEARS-AGO/story-16962452-detail/story.html|newspaper=This is Leicestershire}}</ref> ==Viscounts Hall (1946)== *[[George Henry Hall, 1st Viscount Hall]] (1881–1965) *William George Leonard Hall, 2nd Viscount Hall (1913–1985) ==References== *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hall}} [[Category:Viscountcies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Extinct viscountcies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
